source code¶

extract¶

This module is responsible for transform (E) in ETL.

extract.extract_csv_file(sparksession: pyspark.sql.session.SparkSession, file_path: str) → pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame[source]¶

Extract the csv files into a DF.

Parameters

  • sparksession (SparkSession) – spark session to read the file

  • file_path (str) – file_path to extract

Returns

DataFrame of a csv file where the header is the schema

transform¶

This module is responsible for transform (T) in ETL.

transform.check_if_column_exists_in_df(df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame, column_list_to_be_checked: list) → None[source]¶

Check if column exists in spark dataframe.

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – Spark DataFrame to check if column exists

  • column_list_to_be_checked (list) – List of column names to be checked

transform.clean_df(df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame, input_col: str, output_col: str) → pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame[source]¶

Clean the df’s column by removing non-alphanumeric characters from the column and empty-strings.

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame which contains a column “input_column”

  • input_col (str) – input column for the transformation

  • output_col (str) – output column for the transformation

Returns

DataFrame with cleaned data

transform.count_df(df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame, input_col: str, output_col: str) → pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame[source]¶

Count the instances of the input_column and enters them in output_column.

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame whose column needs to be counted

  • input_col (str) – input column name which should be counted

  • output_col (str) – output column name containing the count

Returns

DataFrame which contains the count of words

transform.df_columns_compare(df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame, compare_expressions: list, error_empty_df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame) → tuple[source]¶

Success and Error dataframe is created after comparing columns.

transform.explode_df(df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame, input_col: str, output_col: str) → pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame[source]¶

Explodes the input_column.

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame which contains a column “input_column”

  • input_col (str) – input column name

  • output_col (str) – output column name

Returns

DataFrame with column exploded

transform.filter_records_having_improper_datetime_value(df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame, column_names: list, error_empty_df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame) → tuple[source]¶

Filter out the records where datetime value is improper.

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – Spark DataFrame whose column is to be renamed

  • column_names (list) – Columns where datetime value check will be performed on spark dataframe

transform.filter_records_having_negative_value(df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame, column_names: list, error_empty_df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame) → tuple[source]¶

Filter out the records where negative values are not accepted and create an error dataframe with a reason.

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – Spark DataFrame whose column is to be renamed

  • column_names (list) – Columns where negative value check will be performed on spark dataframe

transform.lower_case_df(df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame, input_col: str, output_col: str) → pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame[source]¶

Lower cases a DataFrame’s column.

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame whose column needs to be lower cased

  • input_col (str) – input column for the transformation

  • output_col (str) – output column for the transformation

Returns

DataFrame which contains the lower cased column

transform.rename_column_in_df(df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame, old_column_name: str, new_column_name: str) → pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame[source]¶

Rename a column if exists in spark dataframe.

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – Spark DataFrame whose column is to be renamed

  • old_column_name (str) – Old Column Name

  • new_column_name (str) – New Column Name

transform.replace_T_with_negligible_values(df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame, columns_with_data_type_details: list) → pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame[source]¶

Dataframe is created by replacing T with 0.001.

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – Spark DataFrame whose T is to be replaced with negligible values

  • columns_with_data_type_details (List[(str, str, str)]) – List of tuples. Tuple have 3 elements. 0 -> Column Name, 1-> Column DataType, 2->Column Precision

transform.transform_df(raw_df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame) → pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame[source]¶

Count the number of occurrence of words in a single-column raw dataframe.

Parameters

raw_df (DataFrame) – raw dataframe extracted from the text

Returns

DataFrame of single-column text file

transform.typecastcolumns(df: pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame, columns_with_data_type_details: list) → pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame[source]¶

Typecasts the spark dataframe as per the data type and precesion if any.

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – Spark DataFrame whose column is to be renamed

  • columns_with_data_type_details (List[(str, str, str)]) – List of tuples. Tuple have 3 elements. 0 -> Column Name, 1-> Column DataType, 2->Column Precision

load¶

This module is responsible for transform (L) in ETL.

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – dataframe to be written

  • path_to_write (str) – path for csv file to write the file at
